result.title: Your IQ Result
result.lookup_hint: Paste your ID to open your detailed report.
result.disclaimer_iq: This IQ estimate is calculated using normalized z-scores across five cognitive domains: reasoning, math, verbal, spatial, and memory. The scoring model is based on Gaussian normalization of ICAR-like items, scaled to μ = 100 and σ = 15. Scores are indicative, not diagnostic.
result.iq_explainer_short: Your IQ estimate (mean = 100, SD = 15) is plotted on a normal curve. Most people fall between 85 – 115. Shaded regions mark standard ability bands used in research and education.
result.explainer_long: Scores are derived from your accuracy across cognitive domains. Each correct answer contributes to a weighted z-score, normalized to the reference mean (μ = 100, σ = 15). The 95 % confidence interval (CI) reflects expected statistical variation given the number of items answered.
result.explanation_method: The IQ computation method follows psychometric conventions similar to ICAR (Condon & Revelle, 2014) and WAIS standardization norms (Wechsler, 2008). Z-scores per domain are averaged and scaled to match a standard normal distribution. Percentiles are then derived from the cumulative normal distribution Φ(z). This approach is transparent and reproducible.
result.references: References: Condon, D. M. & Revelle, W. (2014). The International Cognitive Ability Resource: Development and initial validation. Intelligence, 43, 52-64. | Wechsler, D. (2008). WAIS-IV Manual. Pearson Assessment.
result.iq_curve_caption: The curve below shows how your estimated IQ compares to the general population.

reasoning.name: Abstract Reasoning
reasoning.desc: Ability to detect patterns, logic, and relationships in visual or conceptual information.

math.name: Quantitative Reasoning
math.desc: Skill in numerical problem-solving and logical operations based on arithmetic or algebraic concepts.

verbal.name: Verbal Reasoning
verbal.desc: Understanding and manipulation of written language, analogies, and verbal logic.

spatial.name: Spatial Visualization
spatial.desc: Ability to mentally rotate, transform, or manipulate visual patterns and geometric forms.

memory.name: Memory & Attention
memory.desc: Short-term recall, sequence recognition, and focused attention under time constraints.

report.overview: Your result summarizes performance across five major cognitive domains.
report.interpretation: Scores are standardized to have a mean of 100 and a standard deviation of 15. Values between 85–115 are within the typical range. Higher scores indicate stronger reasoning and cognitive flexibility.
report.categories_explainer: The per-category results help you understand your cognitive strengths and development areas.

about.title: About this test
about.method: This test is inspired by the International Cognitive Ability Resource (ICAR) and public-domain cognitive items. It provides an open, transparent way to estimate general reasoning ability (g). The dataset and scoring methods are freely available for research use.
about.audience: Suitable for ages 14 and up, for educational, personal, or HR screening use. No identifying data is stored — only an anonymous ID for comparison over time.
about.limitations: This test is not a substitute for professional psychometric assessment. Environmental factors, mood, and language proficiency can affect results.
